messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the lowest temperature this Friday?
Sure—could you tell me which location (for example, a city, ZIP code, or coordinates) you’d like the Friday forecast for?
I don't know where I am right now.

Location services are on—but I don’t have access to your actual coordinates. Could you let me know your city, ZIP/postal code, or even latitude/longitude? With that I can look up Friday’s low temperature for you.
Could you try using the location services to find out?

I’m not actually able to pull your GPS coordinates directly—only check that location services are enabled. You’ll need to tell me an approximate location (for example your city, ZIP/postal code, or even your latitude/longitude) in order to look up Friday’s low temperature.
Unfortunately, I can't provide more detail than I already have. Could you use the tools to figure it out and get back to me?

I’m sorry, but I don’t have a way to pull your actual GPS coordinates—only to check that location services are enabled. Without at least a city name, ZIP/postal code, or latitude/longitude, I can’t look up your local forecast. If you can tell me any one of those, I’ll fetch Friday’s low temperature right away.
